issuetype.name: Story

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: As a cloud user, I want a view of a single image that will size well to different devices and show me information in a clear, easy to understand modeless view.

comments.body:
Pull request:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/43

and

https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/45

* platform is not displaying
* should display all info shown in expando in https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Manage+Images+Landing separated into sections for machine, kernel, ramdisk and block device mappings
* type is not needed
* missing button to create scaling group launch configuration in upper right

Adjusted the issues in the pull request:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/56

The issues have been addressed in the pull request:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/56

Will need the wireframe for the image detail view before proceeding any further
This page looks crazy and nonsensical. I will make you a wireframe for it so you can see exactly how it should be laid out.
Waiting on the wireframe for the image detail view page.

Sorry, I thought [~kgill] had taken this over and no wireframe was needed. [~kyolee] please ping me and we can go over this so you will know what's missing. The wireframe that shows what content needs to be included, and what section it should go in, is at https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/GUI-168
The image detail page is complete AFAICT.  Let us know if we've missed any details.

missing a lot of properties shown in expando in wireframe (see https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Manage+Images+Landing for details). Everything in the expando should be shown on the detail page.
[~kyolee], that string is really hard to read. Can you give me a simple list of which fields no longer apply?
[~kyolee]: Could you respond to the latest question from [~jloza]?

Kernel:

ARCHITECTURE
MANIFEST PATH
DESCRIPTION

Ramdisk:

ARCHITECTURE
MANIFEST PATH
DESCRIPTION
Thanks, [~kyolee], I appreciate it! That's much easier to understand.  I'll have a look assuming those fields you mentioned are no longer valid and therefore not required, and will get back to you.

This is much closer now, thank you! A couple of comments:

* When a "Name" tag is added the behavior is not consistent with other resources. For an example you can look at instances, where the display shows Name (ID) in both the table view on the landing page (that needs fixing here too) and in the single instance view breadcrumb. 
* I don't see the registering account here. Is that still supported? I would assume it is?
* I don't see snapshot info but I assume that is because this image did not come from a snap. Can you just please verify that info will be displayed if the image comes from a snap?

Display of EKI/ERI is in another bug, but that needs to be fixed ASAP, please. It's a bad one. Thanks!

> When a "Name" tag is added the behavior is not consistent with other resources. For an example you can look at instances, where the display shows Name (ID) in both the table view on the landing page (that needs fixing here too) and in the single instance view breadcrumb.

The images on AWS have had names before the "tagged names" were available for the resources. It's not clear whether to replace the actual names with the tagged name for the title display. Suggestion needed.

JLO: In 3.4 we used the tagged name as the name, and just show the image name in a separate field. So where you see Name (ID) it would be the tagged name, please.

> I don't see the registering account here. Is that still supported? I would assume it is?

If I'm not mistaken, the register account is the same as the owner id of the image?

In that case, yes, the information is available:

'owner_id': u'583030202036'

JLO: Awesome! Yes, please include that in the list of attributes, can you please call it "Owner account (ID)" while we are at it, and if there's an owner-alias the format for the value should be "Alias (account number) otherwise just "account number" the same way we do "Name (ID)", if you can retrieve the owner alias. If you can't retrieve that info, then just display the account, thanks!

> I don't see snapshot info but I assume that is because this image did not come from a snap. Can you just please verify that info will be displayed if the image comes from a snap?

I assume what you meant by the snapshot info was the block device mapping information. In that case, yes, the current UI displays the block device mapping information of a registered snapshot image:

Block device mappings

Device
/dev/sda
snapshot_id
snap-24E840D2
Size
1 GB
Delete on termination
True

It looks like from looking at the API documentation that this is no longer supported (the snapshot, outside of the BDM stuff) so don't worry about this. 

> Display of EKI/ERI is in another bug, but that needs to be fixed ASAP.

It's not clear on what you meant here. Current the image detail page displays the EKI and ERI information:

Kernel

Kernel id
eki-A653398E
RAM disk

Ramdisk id
eri-24843771

As mentioned in the previous comment, it won't display other fields of the kernel and ramdisk information since there are not available.

JLO: Don't worry about that, it's a bug on the landing pages. I shouldn't have mentioned it here, it has nothing to do with this work. Sorry!

Thanks for continuing to work on this, it's almost there, it sounds like!

[~kyolee], I edited your comment above to provide inline comments (I prepended them with JLO). They should clarify everything, thanks for all your hard work here! If you need anything else, just give me a call, it's so much faster and easier.

Thanks!

Pull request created at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/129

SO CLOSE! Tiny nit:

* the first field label should be "EMI name" to distinguish it from the tagged name. 

That's it. I'll fix things like the button label cases and text myself when I do the CSS. :)

Pull Request at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/146
